title: Massachusetts sues Kalshi alleging illegal sports gambling
content: Massachusetts argues Kalshi is making more money on sports wagers than legal, licensed sportsbooks.

title: College football picks: Predictions against the spread, odds, betting lines for top 25 games in Week 3
content: A closer look at the top games for the second week of the 2025 college football season

title: Paramount Condemns Israeli Film Boycott After 3,900 Sign Pledge
content: Paramount released a statement condemning a boycott of the Israeli film industry after 3,900 industry names signed the pledge.

title: Margot Robbie Dons Gorgeous ‘Naked Dress’ On Red Carpet, But It’s Getting Some Backlash
content: The “Barbie” star’s risque look is prompting love, hate and befuddlement on social media platforms.

title: Bill passed by California Legislature prohibiting some law enforcement officers from wearing face coverings heads to Gov. Newsom
content: If signed by Gov. Gavin Newsom, Senate Bill 627, known as the No Secret Police Act, would apply to California local and federal officers, and other officers from another state agency.

title: Trump says he'll send National Guard to 'deeply troubled' Memphis
content: President Trump announced in that the federal government is planning to surge federal forces, National Guard and even "the military, too," if needed into Memphis.

title: Giants QB2 Jaxson Dart 'ready whenever my number is called'
content: Giants rookie quarterback Jaxson Dart isn't listening to the public calls for him to become the team's starter, but promises to be "ready whenever my number is called."

title: Ray Dalio calls for 'redistribution policy' when AI and humanoid robots start to benefit the top 1% to 10% more than everyone else
content: The hedge fund billionaire sees a "limited number of winners and a bunch of losers" with the 1% to 10% "benefiting a lot."

title: Trump says he’ll send the National Guard to Memphis to address crime, 'would have preferred' Chicago
content: Mayor Brandon Johnson says united local opposition to a federal intervention led the president to "back down."

title: Widespread availability of graphic Charlie Kirk shooting video shows content moderation challenges
content: Immediately after Charlie Kirk was shot during a college event in Utah, graphic video of what happened was available almost instantly online, from several angles, in slow-motion and real-time speed.
